definitions: process of building something like houses, roads, or bridges using materials and workers
way in which something is arranged or put together to form a complete whole
examples: The construction of the new hospital will take two years
Construction workers arrived early to begin the foundation work
The careful construction of her argument convinced everyone in the meeting
The sentence construction in this essay needs significant improvement

definitions: the day of the week between Tuesday and Thursday
examples: Our team meetings are always scheduled for Wednesday afternoons
The package should arrive by Wednesday at the latest

definitions: action taken to intentionally become involved in a difficult situation to improve it or prevent it from getting worse
medical treatment, especially surgery, performed to improve a patient's health condition
examples: The teacher's early intervention helped the struggling student improve dramatically
Military intervention in the conflict proved to be highly controversial
The surgical intervention saved the patient's life after the accident
Early medical intervention can prevent the disease from progressing further

definitions: act of going to see a person or place for a period of time
official or formal meeting with someone for business or professional purposes
examples: My grandmother enjoys our weekly visits to her house every Sunday
Their visit to Paris lasted for two wonderful weeks
The doctor scheduled a follow-up visit to check the patient's progress
The ambassador's visit strengthened diplomatic relations between the two countries

definitions: land along the edge of an ocean, sea, or other large body of water
examples: They built their vacation home near the coast for ocean views
The storm moved quickly along the eastern coast causing significant damage

definitions: something that is placed over or on top of another thing for protection
reporting or discussion of news events by journalists or media organizations
act of hiding or protecting something or someone from discovery or danger
examples: The plastic cover protected the furniture during the renovation project
She pulled the cover up to her chin on the cold night
The newspaper's cover of the election was thorough and unbiased
Media cover of the scandal continued for several weeks
The soldiers took cover behind the wall during the firefight
His alibi was just a cover for his illegal activities

definitions: informal term for a police officer who enforces laws and maintains public order
examples: The cop directed traffic around the accident scene with practiced efficiency
A friendly cop helped the lost child find her parents

definitions: sport played between two teams of nine players using a bat and ball on a diamond-shaped field
examples: The kids played baseball in the park every Saturday morning
Baseball has been called America's favorite pastime for generations

definitions: message sent electronically from one computer user to another through the internet
examples: Please send me an email with the meeting details by Friday
She checks her email first thing every morning at work

definitions: unexpected and undesirable event, especially one causing damage or injury
examples: The car accident on the highway caused major traffic delays
She broke the vase by accident while cleaning the shelf

definitions: the part or side of something that faces forward or is most prominent
boundary between two different air masses with different temperatures and humidity levels
false appearance or manner adopted to deceive others or hide true feelings
examples: The front of the building features beautiful architectural details
Please move to the front of the line when called
A cold front will bring rain and cooler temperatures tomorrow
The weather front moved through the region causing severe storms
His cheerful demeanor was just a front to hide his disappointment
The legitimate business served as a front for illegal operations

definitions: moral or legal obligation to do something because it is right or required
task or action that someone is required to perform as part of their job
examples: Parents have a duty to care for their children's wellbeing
Citizens consider voting their civic duty in a democracy
The security guard's duties include monitoring cameras and checking identification
Night duty at the hospital can be particularly challenging

definitions: money that a business or organization receives from its normal activities or investments
examples: The company's revenue increased by twenty percent this quarter
Tax revenue funds essential government services and infrastructure projects

definitions: general direction in which something is developing or changing over time
current style or preference that is temporarily popular among many people
examples: The trend toward remote work accelerated during the pandemic significantly
Economic trends suggest continued growth in the technology sector
Fashion trends change rapidly from one season to the next
Social media influencers often set new trends among young people

definitions: circular band worn on the finger, often made of metal
clear resonant sound made by a bell or similar object
enclosed area for boxing or wrestling matches
examples: She wore her grandmother's wedding ring with great pride
The diamond ring sparkled brilliantly in the sunlight
The ring of the doorbell announced the arrival of guests
Her phone's ring interrupted the quiet library atmosphere
The boxer entered the ring to thunderous applause from fans
Both wrestlers circled each other cautiously in the ring

definitions: air taken into or expelled from the lungs during breathing
examples: She took a deep breath before diving into the pool
His breath formed small clouds in the cold winter air

definitions: unit of length equal to one twelfth of a foot or 2.54 centimeters
examples: The shelf needs to be moved three inches to the right
Heavy rainfall totaled more than six inches over the weekend

definitions: part of the body connecting the head to the shoulders and trunk
examples: She wore a beautiful scarf around her neck for warmth
The giraffe's long neck helps it reach leaves in tall trees

definitions: central or most important part of something
basic and most important part of something abstract
examples: The apple core should be thrown in the compost bin
Scientists study the Earth's core to understand planetary formation
Honesty and integrity form the core of her personal values
The core curriculum includes math, science, and language arts

definitions: the number one thousand million, written as 1,000,000,000
examples: The government allocated several billion dollars for infrastructure improvements
Earth's population recently surpassed eight billion people

definitions: failure to hit, reach, catch, or make contact with something
feeling of sadness from the absence of someone or something
title used before the name of an unmarried woman or girl
examples: His first shot was a miss but the second hit the target
The batter's swing and miss struck out the side
I really miss my family when I travel for work
The children miss their dog who passed away last month
Miss Johnson teaches third grade at the elementary school
The letter was addressed to Miss Sarah Williams

definitions: liquid that can be swallowed as refreshment or nourishment
alcoholic beverage or the act of consuming alcohol
examples: Water is the healthiest drink for staying properly hydrated
The restaurant offers a wide variety of hot and cold drinks
They went out for drinks after work on Friday evening
He decided to quit drink after realizing its negative impact

definitions: written works, especially those considered to have artistic or intellectual value
printed material providing information about a particular subject or product
examples: She studied English literature at university for four years
Classic literature continues to influence modern writers and readers
The doctor provided literature about managing diabetes effectively at home
Marketing literature was distributed at the trade show booth

definitions: elected head of a city, town, or municipal government
examples: The mayor announced new initiatives to reduce traffic congestion downtown
Citizens packed the town hall to hear the mayor speak

definitions: quality of being significant, valuable, or worthy of attention and consideration
examples: The importance of regular exercise cannot be overstated for good health
She stressed the importance of arriving on time for the interview

definitions: possibility of suffering harm, injury, damage, or loss
examples: Warning signs alerted hikers to the danger of falling rocks
The endangered species faces danger of extinction without protection efforts

definitions: joint between the thigh and lower leg that allows bending movement
examples: She injured her knee while playing soccer last weekend
The child scraped his knee when he fell off the bicycle

definitions: domesticated hoofed mammal similar to but smaller than a horse
informal term for a person's buttocks
examples: The farmer used an ass to carry supplies up the mountain
The stubborn ass refused to move despite repeated encouragement
He fell and landed hard on his ass
Get your ass in gear or we'll be late

definitions: movement of vehicles, ships, or aircraft along routes
movement of data or signals through a communication system
examples: Heavy traffic during rush hour made the commute take twice as long
Traffic lights help regulate the flow of vehicles at intersections
Website traffic increased dramatically after the viral marketing campaign
Network traffic slowed down due to the large file downloads

definitions: connected series of railway cars pulled by a locomotive engine
series of connected things or events following one another
examples: The train arrived at the station exactly on schedule
High-speed trains connect major cities across the country efficiently
Her train of thought was interrupted by the loud noise
The wedding dress had a long train that swept the floor

definitions: flat dish from which food is eaten or served
thin, flat sheet of metal, glass, or other material
examples: Please put your dirty plate in the dishwasher after dinner
The waiter brought our food on beautifully decorated plates
The metal plate protected the machinery from damage
License plates must be clearly visible on all vehicles

definitions: tools, machinery, and other items needed for a particular purpose or activity
examples: The gym purchased new exercise equipment to replace the old machines
Safety equipment must be worn at all times on the construction site

definitions: room or building used for creating art, music, or media productions
small apartment consisting of one main room
examples: The artist spent long hours painting in her studio
The band recorded their new album at a professional studio
She rented a studio apartment near the university campus
The studio was small but had everything she needed

definitions: information that is kept hidden from others or known only to a few people
examples: She promised to keep his secret and never tell anyone
The company's trade secrets give them a competitive advantage

definitions: machine that converts energy into mechanical force to power vehicles or equipment
examples: The car's engine started making strange noises yesterday morning
Steam engines revolutionized transportation during the Industrial Revolution

definitions: success or good things that happen by chance rather than effort
examples: With a bit of luck, we'll finish the project on time
She had the luck to find a parking spot immediately

definitions: flat rectangular section forming part of a door, wall, or ceiling
group of people chosen to discuss, investigate, or decide on a matter
examples: The wooden panel in the door had beautiful carved details
Solar panels on the roof provide electricity for the house
The panel of judges selected the winner after long deliberation
An expert panel discussed climate change solutions at the conference

definitions: person admired for courage, outstanding achievements, or noble qualities
main character in a story, film, or dramatic work
examples: The firefighter became a hero after rescuing children from the burning building
Local heroes were honored at the community celebration event
The hero of the novel faces many challenges throughout the story
In most action movies, the hero defeats the villain

definitions: perfectly round flat shape where all points are equally distant from the center
group of people with shared interests, professions, or social connections
examples: Draw a circle with a compass for perfect roundness
The children sat in a circle for story time
She moved in elite social circles in the city
His circle of friends supported him through difficult times

definitions: person who reviews and evaluates artistic works professionally
person who expresses disapproval or finds fault with something
examples: The film critic gave the movie a glowing review
Food critics from major newspapers visited the new restaurant
He was his own harshest critic, never satisfied with his work
Critics of the policy argued it would increase costs

definitions: one part of a television or radio series
distinct period or event in a sequence of related occurrences
examples: The final episode of the season ended with a cliffhanger
She missed last week's episode of her favorite show
This was just another episode in their ongoing family drama
The patient experienced episodes of severe anxiety

definitions: careful examination or verification of something
written order to a bank to pay money from an account
pattern of squares in alternating colors
examples: The mechanic performed a thorough check of the car's brakes
Security checks at the airport ensure passenger safety
She wrote a check to pay for the groceries
The check bounced due to insufficient funds
His shirt had a blue and white check pattern
The tablecloth featured a classic red check design

definitions: something that is necessary or must be done, had, or provided to achieve a purpose
examples: A college degree is a requirement for this job position
The software doesn't meet the minimum system requirements

definitions: person who is professionally involved in politics, especially as an elected official
examples: The politician campaigned on promises to improve education funding
Many politicians attended the international climate summit

definitions: water that falls from clouds in the sky in drops
examples: The rain watered the garden so we didn't need to
Heavy rain caused flooding in low-lying areas of the city

definitions: person who works with you in the same organization or profession
examples: She discussed the project proposal with her colleagues at lunch
His colleagues surprised him with a retirement party

definitions: alcoholic drink made from fermented grains, typically barley and flavored with hops
examples: He ordered a cold beer to enjoy with his pizza
The brewery produces several different types of craft beer

definitions: physical activity done to improve health, fitness, or strength
task or activity done to practice or test a skill
examples: Regular exercise helps maintain a healthy weight and reduces stress
She does yoga exercises every morning before work
The math teacher assigned practice exercises from chapter five
Military exercises tested the troops' readiness for deployment

definitions: system of government where power is held by the people through free elections and equal participation
examples: Democracy allows citizens to vote for their representatives
The country transitioned from dictatorship to democracy after the revolution

definitions: place and time where something happens or is positioned
time, place, and circumstances in which a story takes place
position or level at which a device or control is set
examples: The restaurant's outdoor setting overlooked the beautiful lake
The rural setting provided a peaceful environment for writing
The novel's setting in Victorian England shaped the characters' behavior
Science fiction often uses futuristic settings to explore ideas
Adjust the temperature setting on the thermostat to save energy
The camera's manual settings allow for creative control
